definition: parent/one's own (flesh and blood)/relative/related/marriage/bride/close/intimate/in person/first-hand/in favor of/pro-/to kiss/(Internet slang) dear
old variant of 曆|历[li4]/old variant of 歷|历[li4]

sentences.english: It was like an old man and had seen all kinds of departure.
sentences.chinese: 它就像个历经沧桑的老人，亲历过各种离愁别绪。

sentences.english: It is a picture that those who were able to attend the Games will carry with them forever.
sentences.chinese: 这一画面将被亲历过北京奥运会的人们所永远铭记。

sentences.english: Bosses have to roll up their sleeves and work.
sentences.chinese: 老板得卷起袖管亲历亲为。

sentences.english: The author has experienced the Japanese culture to China hugeness influence.
sentences.chinese: 笔者亲历过日本文化对中国的影响之巨大。

definition: to see for oneself/to see with one's own eyes
to witness/to see at first hand/to see with one's own eyes
to feel as if it had happened to oneself/to sympathize/(polite expression of gratitude for a favor received by a friend etc) I take it as a personal favor
shaking one to the core/extremely disturbing/hair-raising (idiom)
(idiom) to experience it for oneself/to actually *be* there (as opposed to reading about it etc)
to know from experience/to learn through experience/to realize/understanding/experience
